com.yantra.api.ycd

Interface getFulfillmentSummaryDetails

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCDApi, YIFApi

    public interface getFulfillmentSummaryDetails
    getFulfillmentSummaryDetails API will be used in Fulfillment Summary Details.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getFulfillmentSummaryDetails(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inDoc)
      This API will take the unique attributes of the order as the input and returns the output grouped based on the fulfillment methods.

    • Method Detail

      • getFulfillmentSummaryDetails

        org.w3c.dom.Document getFulfillmentSummaryDetails(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                  org.w3c.dom.Document inDoc)
                                           throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                                  java.rmi.RemoteException
        This API will take the unique attributes of the order as the input and returns the output grouped based on the fulfillment methods. So, there are ShipingGroup and PickupGroup elements which have order lines that are Shipping and Pickup respectively. This API currently ignores the order lines which have fulfillment method Delivery.

        This API works in two modes. 1. Small Order Mode (Default Mode):
        In this mode the IsLargeOrder flag is set to "N" In this mode API will obtain the order details from getCompleteOrderDetails API and availability details from getPossibleSchedules API.

        ShippingGroups element is available when there are order lines which have Shipping as the fulfillment method The order lines of the shipping fulfillment method are formed based on the number of Interaction elements that the getPossibleSchedules API returns. Hence, there will be ShippingGroup element for every Interaction element. ShippingGroup element represents the The attributes within the ShippingGroup element are taken form the Interaction element. The PersonInfoShipto element under the ShippingGroup element represents the ship to address, where the order lines within the ShippingGroup are going to be shipped.

        PickupGroups element is available if there are order lines which have Pickup as the delivery method. Each PickupGroup represents the ship node from where the customer is going to pickup the items. ShipNodePersonInfo element under each PickupGroup element represents the address of the ship node.

        Unavailable lines are displayed under UnavailableLines element. Under this element, order lines are categorized based on fulfillment method. UnavailableQty attribute gives the quantity that is unavailable for that order line. Example: If there is an order line with 5 quantity, out of that 3 are available and 2 are unavailable, then the 2 will be the value of the UnavailableQty attribute Here we also show PickupLinesWithNoShipnode which has the pickup lines without ship node.

        2. Large Order Mode:
        In this mode the IsLargeOrder flag is set to "Y". API doesn't fetch the availability of the order lines. It returns the order details by calling getCompleteOrderDetails API. getPossibleSchedules API is not called in this mode. Additionally, API doesn't fetch the order lines in this mode. It just gives the unique Ship To Addresses in the order , and the unique pickup groups in the order. getCompleteOrderLineList API is used to return the unique ship to keys, and pickup groups.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Additional Information


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inDoc - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains the order details grouped based on fulfillment details. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
